benchmark_details.name: MM-Food-100K
benchmark_details.overview: MM-Food-100K is a high-quality, 100,000-sample multimodal food intelligence dataset designed for fine-tuning AI models, featuring diverse dishes and ingredients with rich, multi-level annotations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality, multimodal food intelligence dataset for fine-tuning AI models.

data.source: Curated from a larger 1.2 million corpus collected from 87,000+ contributors.
data.annotation: Mixed human and AI annotations with evidence and provenance for auditability.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance on validation and test sets.
methodology.interpretation: Lower MAE and RMSE indicate better model performance, while higher R2 indicates better fit of the data.
methodology.baseline_results: Models fine-tuned on MM-Food-100K significantly outperform original Large Vision-Language Models.
methodology.validation: Performance is validated using a stratified split (80/10/10) of data by cuisine and source type.

harm: Potential for bias in data representation across different cuisines.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Datasets released under conditions permitting public research use.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Contributors were invited with zero upfront payment, focusing on attribution and revenue sharing.
